channel.title: Changing Theme
channel.description: Hi, i need help with my client about to change the theme. The standard theme is white and i want it to black if anyone can help me pls post your answers here or add me on msn owner@infexis.com.. Thank You!

item.title: Changing Theme
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

P0own3ed:

Uhmm but i got an folder named applet.java can it be that one?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2009, 03:28:13 am[/size][hr]exactly its named Applet_sub1.java[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2009, 04:00:24 am[/size][hr]PLEASE ANYONE I REALLY NEED YOUR HELP

dude, in your Jframe (Or GUI) add this

import javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalLookAndFeel;

Read full topic

item.title: Changing Theme
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

[quote=“skinzoskinz, post:2, topic:286618”]I think if you go to your Client folder there should be a folder in there called “Sprites”

If you go into this folder, it should have a load of pictures with the graphics of your client on them.

If you open these, and change them ( SAVE THEM WITHOUT CHANGING THE NAME ) then it should overwrite perfectly, and change your client.

If they are white - make them black, but be careful. I would reccommend using PaintShop Pro, because it allows you to darken and lighten images without actually touching them yourself.

Hope this helps :)[/quote]He means the Jframe i presume, depending on what client your using open up RSApplet.java, and search for the current colour or theme that the jframe is set as, and change it to black.

Read full topic

Uumm i cant find it in sprites… I mean the client is white not any picture!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Changing Theme
item.dc:creator: @skinzoskinz skinzoskinz
item.description:
@skinzoskinz wrote:

I think if you go to your Client folder there should be a folder in there called “Sprites”

If you go into this folder, it should have a load of pictures with the graphics of your client on them.

If you open these, and change them ( SAVE THEM WITHOUT CHANGING THE NAME ) then it should overwrite perfectly, and change your client.

If they are white - make them black, but be careful. I would reccommend using PaintShop Pro, because it allows you to darken and lighten images without actually touching them yourself.

Hope this helps

Read full topic
